org.vertx.java.core.cluster

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vertx.java.core.cluster.Sendable
      • org.vertx.java.core.cluster.Message

  • public class Message
extends Sendable

    Represents a message sent on the event bus.

    Author:
    Tim Fox

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.lang.String address
      The address where the message is being sent
      Buffer body
      The body (payload) of the message
      java.lang.String messageID
      The unique id of the message - this is filled in by the event bus when the message is sent

      • Message

       Buffer body)
        Create a new Message
        Parameters:
        address - The address to send the message to
        body -

    • Method Detail

      • reply

        public void reply(Buffer body)
        Reply to this message. If the message was sent specifying a receipt handler, that handler will be called when it has received a reply. If the message wasn't sent specifying a receipt handler this method does nothing. Replying to a message this way is equivalent to sending a message to an address which is the same as the message id of the original message.

      • reply

        public void reply()
        Same as reply(Buffer) but with an empty buffer
